Synthesis of Organic Linkers.Synthetic Strategy: Based on palladium-catalyzed Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling reactions. The general strategy was to couple two equivalents of a terminal boronic ester part to a dihalide intermediate. The Suzuki-Miyaura cross-coupling conditions used CsF or K2CO3 as base with Pd(dppf)Cl2 as the catalyst in a p-dioxane / H2O (4:1 v/v) mixture.

Ni-MOF-74.Synthesis: Synthesized and activated according to literature procedure. Demonstrated stability in water.

Ni-IRMOF-74-II.Synthesis: Using capillaries (diameter: 0.6 mm, quartz made by Hampton Research) with a wavelength of 1.23823 Å (Supplementary Figure 5).
Ni-IRMOF-74-II.Water stability test: 10 mg of activated Ni-IRMOF-74 was immersed in 5 mL deionized water for 24 hours before centrifugation, washed by ethanol three times, and dried under vacuum (10-2 Torr) at room temperature for 12 h followed by heating at 130 °C for 12 h.

Characterization of ssDNA Loaded MOFs.Control experiments of fluorophore molec: Used 6-carboxyfluorescein (FAM) and 6-carboxytetramethylrhodamine (TAMRA) to investigate interactions. Found that uptake of TAMRA increased from IRMOF-74-II to -V indicating an increase in π-π interaction, while MIL-101 exhibited negligible uptake due to limited phenyl units.
Characterization of ssDNA Loaded MOFs.Inclusion of entire ssDNA into MOF pores: Used ssDNA labeled with FAM at 5’ end and TAMRA at 3’ end. Concurrent decay of fluorescence at both wavelengths was observed in the solution, indicating the proper accommodation of the entire ssDNA into MOF pores.

Quantification of the Uptake and Release.General method: Preparation of MOF and ssDNA storage solution. Fluorescence measurement for FAM and TAMRA. Quantification method of ssDNA based on fluorescence decay.
Quantification of the Uptake and Release.Uptake of FAM-labeled ssDNA by other MOF: Tested Ni-MOF-74, UiO-66, UiO-67, and MIL-101-Cr. Found MIL-101-Cr can remove almost all of the ssDNA from the solution, while UiO-66 and UiO-67 show relatively low uptake.
Quantification of the Uptake and Release.Control experiment of FAM labeled ssDNA: Tested metal ions, linker II, physical mixture of metal ions and linker II, and Ni-IRMOF-74-II. Significant decrease of FI was observed only in Ni-IRMOF-74-II.

Comparison of ssDNA Protection Performan.Preparation of ssDNA in vectors: Describes the protocol for ssDNA uptake into Lipo and cationic polymer (Neofect) and other MOF vectors.
Comparison of ssDNA Protection Performan.Release of ssDNA from vectors: Describes the process for releasing ssDNA from vectors using centrifugation and measuring the supernatant for polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (PAGE) test.
Comparison of ssDNA Protection Performan.Analysis of stability of ssDNA in 10% FB: Tested the protection of ssDNA using various porous materials in FBS with 10% serum. Found Ni-IRMOF-74 series offers superior protection against degradation.

Investigation of Interactions between ss.X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS): Performed on Ni-IRMOF-74-II before and after loading with ssDNA. Found no obvious shift in the Ni peaks, indicating no significant interaction exists between metal site and ssDNA in Ni-IRMOF-74-II.
Investigation of Interactions between ss.X-ray adsorption spectra (XAS) of ssDNA: Confirmed the interaction between ssDNA molecules and SBU metals in MOFs and further study the coordination environment of metals in MOFs after loading with ssDNA.
Investigation of Interactions between ss.Zeta potential analysis: Tested for Ni-IRMOF-74-II series and ssDNA in aqueous solution; both are negative, suggesting that the interaction between them is not electrostatic force.

ssDNA Transfection Efficiency Revealed b.Detection of the intracellular delivery: MCF-7 cells were incubated with FAM labeled DNAzyme (FAM-DNAzyme, 100 nM) loaded nano-MOF and naked FAM-DNAzyme (100 nM) for 3 h at 37 °C.
ssDNA Transfection Efficiency Revealed b.Flow cytometry: Describes the preparation of ssDNA loaded vector materials and analysis through flow cytometry.

Cytotoxicity Assessment of Ni-IRMOF-74 S.The cytotoxicity test of nano-MOF in MCF: MCF-7 cells were incubated with different concentrations of nano-MOF for 48h and measured by MTT assay.
MCF-7 cells were treated with different concentrations of ssDNA-vector complexes for 48 h and measured by SRB assay.
RAW264.7 and THP-1 cells were incubated with vectors with saturated ssDNA and measured by the CCK-8 assays.
